page.title: 01MATHEWS BRICKWORKS CHESHAM
page.content: The brickworks was built in 1923. During the World War II,the place was closed down.Production started again in 1946.The brickworks produces 50000 bricks per week.They get their materials from ST.Leonards,and the bricks are sold in London.The brickworks employ 14 local people. Since the place was built there have been many modifications.The whole brickworks occupies a very large area. The bricks are transported by lorry. The longest distance that has been travelled to deliver bricks was to Wales.The working hours of the employ_ ees is from 7am.to 3.45pm.The brick_ works has 3 kilns.Each kiln holds 60000 bricks,which take 36 hours to burn.Afterwards,they are stored in a cubical.Each cubical holds 70000 bric_ ks.They are sold in packs of 500.
